tagline: We Prove It Before You Buy
description: Three logo variations based on the fulcrum concept - the precise pivot point where leverage transforms small force into significant movement. Each successive variation increases in creativity while maintaining professional elegance.
targetAudience: 50-65+ technology-hesitant business owners who've been burned by agencies

results.name: fulcrum-1
results.title: Conservative Fulcrum - Classic Interpretation
results.visualDescription: A classic inverted navy triangle balanced perfectly on its apex point, with a small gold triangular tip at the bottom representing the fulcrum point. A subtle shadow grounds the composition. Clean, timeless, professional - exactly what you'd expect on a respected consulting firm's glass door.
results.conceptDescription: Classic balanced triangle on apex - timeless precision. The gold tip represents the critical leverage point where small strategic input creates significant output.
results.promptSummary: Inverted equilateral triangle in navy balanced on apex, gold tip at the fulcrum point, clean white background, flat vector style

results.name: fulcrum-2
results.title: Distinctive Fulcrum - The Wedge Variation
results.visualDescription: An elongated navy wedge shape (approximately 3:1 height to width ratio) with a distinctive gold tip at the bottom. The stretched proportions create dynamic tension and drama. More memorable and purposeful than the conservative version - like a precision tool designed to move mountains.
results.conceptDescription: Elongated wedge with bold gold tip - dynamic and substantial. The extreme elongation creates visual tension and suggests focused, powerful force.
results.promptSummary: Elongated inverted triangle/wedge in navy with 3:1 or 4:1 height ratio, gold tip section at bottom, clean horizontal transition between colors

results.name: fulcrum-3
results.title: Maximum Creativity - Intersection Point Transformation
results.visualDescription: Two intersecting angular planes forming an X-like composition - one in navy (upper left to lower right) and one in gold (upper right to lower left). At their intersection point, a bright gold diamond marks the critical fulcrum moment. The composition is architectural and sophisticated, suggesting the intersection of forces where transformation occurs.
results.conceptDescription: Two intersecting planes with gold diamond at intersection - architectural and extraordinary. Represents the precise coordinate where strategic input meets amplified results.
results.promptSummary: Two angular planes/chevrons crossing, navy and muted gold with bright gold diamond at intersection point, architectural composition

evaluation.substanceTest: All three logos would be taken seriously by a 58-year-old business owner. They convey precision, expertise, and substance without being flashy or trendy.
evaluation.precisionTest: Every angle and proportion feels intentional. The geometric forms are clean and purposeful.
evaluation.clicheTest: Successfully avoids generic business imagery - no arrows, handshakes, globes, or swooshes.
evaluation.scaleTest: All marks should be recognizable at small sizes due to simple geometric forms.
evaluation.trustTest: The designs feel like a firm that proves results through precision and expertise.
evaluation.timelessnessTest: These designs will look appropriate in 10+ years - they rely on fundamental geometric principles rather than trends.

recommendation: Fulcrum-3 (Intersection Point) offers the most distinctive and memorable mark while still maintaining professional gravitas. It best captures the brand concept of 'leverage' through the visual metaphor of two forces meeting at a transformative point. However, Fulcrum-1 may be preferred for more conservative applications.
